In my opinion, there is a specific stereotype that bugs me. It's the idea that all people who are overweight are lazy and eat junk food all day.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

---

In my opinion, there is a specific stereotype that bugs me. It's the idea that all people who are overweight are lazy and eat junk food all day. Although society has gotten better and you see it less, there is still plenty of this type of stereotype portrayed in TV and film. Often times in movies you see that the person who is greedy or just plain lazy is portrayed by an overweight person.

Although society has gotten better and you see it less, there is still plenty of this type of stereotype portrayed in TV and film. Often times in movies you see that the person who is greedy or just plain lazy is portrayed by an overweight person. Most of the time, this is not true at all. In my opinion, there is a specific stereotype that bugs me. It's the idea that all people who are overweight are lazy and eat junk food all day. Although society has gotten better and you see it less, there is still plenty of this type of stereotype portrayed in TV and film. Often times in movies you see that the person who is greedy or just plain lazy is portrayed by an overweight person. Most of the time, this is not true at all. In real life, plenty of people who are both lazy AND greedy are often beautiful and healthy looking. That message perpetuates a misleading image about something that is far from healthy. In addition to that the overweight person stereotype is usually given horrible lines to say and laughs at themselves and their predicament. It is common to see less character development over all with overweight stereotype characters. This gives a damaging view of things to society as though a person who is overweight isn't capable of change or is somehow less than human.

In my opinion, there is a specific stereotype that bugs me. It's the idea that all people who are overweight are lazy and eat junk food all day. Although society has gotten better and you see it less, there is still plenty of this type of stereotype portrayed in TV and film. Often times in movies you see that the person who is greedy or just plain lazy is portrayed by an overweight person. Most of the time, this is not true at all. In real life, plenty of people who are both lazy AND greedy are often beautiful and healthy looking. That message perpetuates a misleading image about something that is far from healthy. In addition to that the overweight person stereotype is usually given horrible lines to say and laughs at themselves and their predicament. It is common to see less character development over all with overweight stereotype characters. This gives a damaging view of things to society as though a person who is overweight isn't capable of change or is somehow less than human. 
Another reason this type of stereotype makes me cringe is simply because I'm a caring human being and I personally know people who have suffered emotionally because of being over weight.

In my opinion, there is a specific stereotype that bugs me. It's the idea that all people who are overweight are lazy and eat junk food all day. Although society has gotten better and you see it less, there is still plenty of this type of stereotype portrayed in TV and film. Often times in movies you see that the person who is greedy or just plain lazy is portrayed by an overweight person. Most of the time, this is not true at all. In real life, plenty of people who are both lazy AND greedy are often beautiful and healthy looking. That message perpetuates a misleading image about something that is far from healthy. In addition to that the overweight person stereotype is usually given horrible lines to say and laughs at themselves and their predicament. It is common to see less character development over all with overweight stereotype characters. This gives a damaging view of things to society as though a person who is overweight isn't capable of change or is somehow less than human. 
Another reason this type of stereotype makes me cringe is simply because I'm a caring human being and I personally know people who have suffered emotionally because of being over weight. I know they often are harder on themselves because of this type of stereotype.

What Stereotypical Characters Make You Cringe?

What stereotypical characters in books, movies or television shows make you cringe and why? Would you ever not watch or read something because of its offensive portrayal of someone?

---

In my opinion, there is a specific stereotype that bugs me. It's the idea that all people who are overweight are lazy and eat junk food all day. Although society has gotten better and you see it less, there is still plenty of this type of stereotype portrayed in TV and film. Often times in movies you see that the person who is greedy or just plain lazy is portrayed by an overweight person. Most of the time, this is not true at all. In real life, plenty of people who are both lazy AND greedy are often beautiful and healthy looking. That message perpetuates a misleading image about something that is far from healthy. In addition to that the overweight person stereotype is usually given horrible lines to say and laughs at themselves and their predicament. It is common to see less character development over all with overweight stereotype characters. This gives a damaging view of things to society as though a person who is overweight isn't capable of change or is somehow less than human. 

Another reason this type of stereotype makes me cringe is simply because I'm a caring human being and I personally know people who have suffered emotionally because of being over weight. I know they often are harder on themselves because of this type of stereotype. Watching movies and film should be a way to escape and enjoy some downtime. Not feel like the world is laughing at you and you are some seen as immoral for who you are. In conclusion, overweight stereotype characters bother me the most, because they are hurtful to innocent people and they aren't even funny.
